comment: She is very sweet and makes the lectures very engaging, makes the class fun. Helps as much as possible, available outside of class, and overall the ideal professor especially for a class like this. I don't even know how specific to be in this bc she is just all round teacher.

Professor Jones is a nice professor but my gripe is with her text/quizzes. The wording is so annoying and puzzling. As an exaggerated example, you'll read in the notes that "x is black." Then on the quiz, the answer choices will be charcoal, midnight, etc. It is never straightforward. Most of the class got a 40-60 on the final. She curved after.

This professor will teach you to be extremely detail-oriented. The smallest lack of detail or too much detail and she'll take points off. Besides her grading scheme, loved the class and thoroughly enjoyed the project. Always ask questions, but make sure you've gone through ALL her provided materials first or she will not give you an answer.

For a group project, she gave very vague instructions, and then got very mad at the class when we all submitted the wrong format. She gave the class a resubmission, but my group got "i expected this to be right" as our feedback, so we added extra information to cover everything, and she took off 15 points for 'extra information made it confusing'.

Professor Jones is a pretty good professor who gives good lectures in class. She has a few projects with very clear criteria. Just make sure to follow formatting to a T, otherwise, she automatically fails you. Don't let that scare you away because if you DO follow the instructions she is a very fair grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The first half of the semester was fine, but after the midterm it all went downhill. Quiz and final questions became objective, select lectures became required listening, the guest speaker's lecture became a big part of quizzes and the final. Overall, not a horrible professor, but with the sudden changes in the course, not the best, either.

My favorite KSU professor, learned a ton from her about user design. If you put in a moderate amount of effort into the class, you'll do well. The materials she gives you are relevant and pretty interesting. Her one fault is she'll stop class if people are talking/on their phones so don't do that. It's more disruptive than if she left them alone.

This proffessor seemed to really enjoy her position of power. While the content, quizes, and tests werent inheriently hard she made them to trick you every step of the way. Ive heart people say that she is great in person and maybe so but do not take this class online. She will try to screw you over every step of the way. Doesnt respond to emails.

I took this class mostly without much issue online, but I felt she was unprofessional and rude. She'd often send out frustrated announcements filled with all caps when students would ask for clarification on assignments, and would tank whole categories of the final project over minor violations (e.g. 0/5 in conventions for wrong footnote symbol).

Prof. Jones was great. She always answered emails quickly and was always polite. I took her online and she recorded and uploaded every lecture which was super helpful. Quizzes and tests are a bit hard which is normal for CS but the deliverables were easy. One big project the whole semester working with a partner (developing an app).

Her teaching style is a bit odd. Its mores like a high school way of teaching which isn't a bad thing I guess. However she also treats you like a 16 yo. No phones are allowed in class which is understandable but she will literally stop class 5 minutes to call you out and rant. She is a fine but she needs to learn to leave people alone sometimes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great Professor! She does require you to do readings before class but nothing painful or crazy. Class consists of a term long project that was quite fun and unique and she gives out plenty of details and feedback. She's also 100% clear on how she grades everything. Her tests can be a bit challenging but other than that she's not that bad.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: My 2nd course with Prof Jones and still one of my favorite professors. Shes knowledgeable and wants you to do well! The course is based around a term project with 2 tests and a few quizzes. If you read, participate , and show up to class you should do well. All the major assignments are based on a clear rubric, follow it and youll do fine !
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: I took her for Intro to SWE online and honestly it was a bit of a mess. Instead of making the class her own, she instead copied another professor's curriculum and had to "ask" for answers about specific things. That's not good! Her tests that she wrote were great at least. I'm taking her again for User Design, hopefully she's better in person!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Attendance is graded, but she expects you to learn everything from reading and not through lectures. She tests way too much on knowledge of textbook and not on understanding of the concepts. If she gets a hint that you didn't read (which is required to pass the PRE-MODULE QUIZZES), she will give you a quiz again. Take a different elective course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took this course in fall 2017 and looking back she was one of the best professors Ive had at KSU. I was brand new to programming and finished with an A. Was really knowledgeable (especially on C#) for the class and helped me learn a lot though the labs and unity projects. Would take her again any chance I could!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Jones is very helpful and wants you to succeed. Just make sure to complete work on time, ask questions and check your work with her before submitting, especially on projects. The class consists of term long proj worth 40%, 2 tests (midterm and final) which are open note, as well as discussion and quizzes. Ask Questions!
Great class. Lab is all or nothing for the most part so take advantage of getting the labs early and practice before lab

Yes, she doesn't allow cell phones or likes when people talk, but guess what? She actually cares about you and understanding the material. Shes an AMAZING professor, and goes above and beyond for her students. Her lectures are awesome, and time passes by so fast. Easy A if you want it to be I have to say, shes one of the best. Just pay attention

The labs are pretty easy so long as you pay attention in class. If you miss class, you better do your work outside of class or you will be miles behind everyone else. Online Quizzes occasionally. 3 tests as well as 3 project grades that are 20% of your grade. If you go to class and do well in the labs, the class should be fine for you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I had Sandra for both CSE 1301 and 1302 and I will be taking her again for User-Centered Design next semester. She is great and very helpful. 1301 is a weed out class for Game Design Majors since it is about programming and not just about "Having great ideas" so some people may take out their frustrations on here, but don't be fooled she is great!

Sandra is the best college professor I've had.  She is honest, caring, and demanding, but if you put in the effort she will go an extra mile to help you.  Hands down the best teacher to take 1301 with.

She's no-nonsense which I appreciate. She can kind of get like a high school teacher when she has to shush talking students or tell people to stop using their phones. At first, I was not a fan of her "No Laptops" rule, but I ended up performing a lot better because of that.  Lots of group work and participation matters!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Sandra Jones is an awesome teacher.  She does want you to be in class and she does care about your grades.  She is very helpful and gives good feedback on all assignments.  She is very understanding about mess ups and is always willing to help you.

Sandra Jones in my opinion is a great professor. If you go into any programming classes she teaches with no experience she will help you. She gives her office time to help students. If you go to class and pay attention you should be fine. She is very caring and wants you to pass her class.

Great professor, very clear& fair to students. She gives  what's needed to get an A. Reading is sometimes lengthy, but labs and quizzes are doable if you go to class, pay attention, and do the reading. I have no coding experience I am making an A in the class. I don't care for the game design aspect, but she was helpful when I went to her about it.

Sandra is a pretty good teacher. She has a background working in code, so she is knowledgeable. She seems there more so to teach the basic fundamentals of programming more so than the concrete lining of coding, as it is an intro course. I already took coding before entering this class, so it was pretty easy. She tries to be up front with students.

Prof. Jones is really confusing. She expects students to just learn mostly from the textbook online. Her lectures can be really confusing and don't really help people learn in terms of programming.  Many students in her class have no experience in coding and most of the time she seems like she wants you to already know the material beforehand.
